text.p: These are some of the leading stories in Syrian newspapers on Tuesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- President gives daily al-Baath a speech on Party Day. Says we will never give up a single inch of our land.
- Mass rally on party's golden jubilee. Assistant secretary-general of the Baath Party al-Ahmar says: Syria strongly believes in Arab nations' rights.
- In a cable to President Hafez al-Assad, Chinese leader Jiang Zemin appreciates ties with Syria.
- Egyptian President Hosni Mubarak calls for setting peace process on right track.
- Oman refuses visas to Israeli diplomats.
- Former U.S. assistant secretary of state Richard Murphy says: Israel's settlement policy is against peace.
- Syria's parliament speaker Qaddoura says Israel rejects basis of the peace process.
- Russia's Foreign Minister Yevgeny Primakov says no peace could be achieved without Syria and Lebanon.
- Jordanian authorities arrest 13 students and accuse them of planning to burn the Israeli embassy in the Jordanian capital.
